title: A conversation about autofill
body:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cj7ZZPIwdac

This video is so accurate, and that isn't a good thing.

replies.body:
As much as Autofill is annoying for some people, In OCE we just don't have the numbers for everyone to get what they want all the time. 
Its not fair, but its the way it is. People who put Mid and Top in as their two roles just end up with 15 min queues. While anyone who puts support anywhere near their preferred roles, only ever get support and have wait times in single digit seconds.

No one likes being autofilled, but everyone seems to forget that just a year ago, it was pick order determining roles, and you had a 1 in 5 chance of getting your role every game.

I personally prefer to take my chances being autofilled, than rely on the 20% chance that the computer puts me first in the lobby. _(there used to be a time when being able to play more than 2 roles was blatantly expected of all players, and not just be in the realms of fiction like it is today.)_

So we can complain as much as we want, but in the end, there needs to be a compromise somewhere, and autofill is just the least worse one so far.

>and you had a 1 in 5 chance of getting your role every game.

That is not how pick order worked.

Also with regards to the whole expected to play more than 2 roles, that's all well and good, but when riot spent a year trying to give us just our 2 roles and then comes back with the whole "Oh now you have to play all the roles again." shit it's kinda pathetic.

Also the issue is that you can get auto filled without needing to (there have been cases with streamers and such, and i have ran into it myself.) so we have to trust that riot's system doesn't just decide to use the autofill because it's too stupid to realize it can make the game without it.

Plus i have to ask, did you watch the video at all?

Thats pretty much how it worked, you randomly get put in an order, and you just have to pray that the people ahead of you didn't want your role. 

Riot did spend ages trying to get us our preferred roles, they did, found that it wasn't working as expected, and so needed to compromise to make queues healthy again.

Plus whats wrong with learning multiple roles? Understanding the game better can only make you better, not worse.

And yes i watched the video, but that doesn't make autofill any less needed for queue health.

No one likes being auto filled, _(i don't like it either)_ but it does help us all have games much faster. So i feel it is necessary, _(especially if we are getting 10 bans soon, which will make loading screen a little longer as well.)_
Top to bottom, first pick to whats left thats it. I got mid and top a few times as the fifth person

Faker once said that you're not good at league unless you can play all roles. Autofill definitely makes that a necessity
